result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:03 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Joel Edward Hammer in court.  Attorney Kenneth Charles Pletcher in court for Joel Edward Hammer.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin.  S/T of Deputy Antony VanSomeren.  Direct by ADA Damrau. Court questions Deputy.  Cross by Atty Pletcher. Court questions Deputy.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court notes an amended bond order has been signed. No bond violation relative to the earlier bond.  DE is now reconnected with JSC since DE has been discharged from the hospital.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 9:20 AM. bph
Arraignment scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Arraignment on November 16, 2022 at 11:15 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Cover Letter to NOR & Demand for Discovery and Inspection. bph
filed by Atty Pletcher. bph

Adjustment Number: 22A 089173,
Payable Number: 244821,
Receipt Number: 22R 012606,
Amount: $20.00

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least FOUR times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

1:07 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. Defendant Joel Edward Hammer in court.  Attorney Kenneth Charles Pletcher in court for Joel Edward Hammer.  Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin. DE confirms address and DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waive reading. Bond argument; bond ordered. Waive speedy prelim. Court sets Prelim. Adjourned at 1:11 PM.  gll
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Filed by Victim Witness. kma
JA spoke to Defendant on this date to inform him his INIT was reset to 9-9-2022 @ 1:00 pm, in person. RJG

2:06 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris Defendant Joel Edward Hammer not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Becker requesting warrant.  Court services states DE is at Regions Hospital.  ADA Becker confirms it's possible DE received a head injury.  Court reschedules matter to Friday 9/9/22, at 1:00.  If DE was discharged prior to 1:00 this afternoon court will issue warrant. Court requesting reasonable efforts are made to inform DE of new court date. Adjourned at 2:08 PM.  bph
Initial appearance scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
